# Azure Local 2510 Release And New Preview Features

[Home](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/)[Microsoft](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/category/microsoft/), [Microsoft Azure](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/category/microsoft/microsoft-azure/), [Virtualization](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/category/virtualization/)Azure Local 2510 Release And New Preview Features

[Email](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#)

Microsoft has just dropped the [Azure Local](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/tag/azure-local/) 2510 release, and it’s packed with powerful new features aimed at boosting edge resilience, security, and deployment flexibility. You can leare more about this release here:

- ➡️ [Features and improvements in 2510](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-local/whats-new?view=azloc-2510&preserve-view=true#features-and-improvements-in-2510)
- ➡️ [Security updates for Azure Local](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-local/security-update/security-update?view=azloc-2510&viewFallbackFrom=azloc-25010&preserve-view=true&tabs=os-build-25398-xxxx)

## New Azure Local features and previews

At the same time the Azure Local team also made new feature and previews available:

- **⭐ Software Defined Network with NSG (GA):** This feature allows customers to create and manage network security groups (NSGs) and network security rules for their Azure Local VMs, providing enhanced network security and segmentation capabilities.
Learn more: [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-local/concepts/sdn-overview?view=azloc-2510](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-local/concepts/sdn-overview?view=azloc-2510)
- **⭐ Rack Aware Cluster (Public Preview):** This allows customers to define local availability zones based on physical racks in their datacenter, enhancing the cluster resilience, minimizing the risk of data loss and downtime in the event of a rack-level failure.
Learn more: [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-local/concepts/rack-aware-cluster-overview?view=azloc-2510](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-local/concepts/rack-aware-cluster-overview?view=azloc-2510)
- ⭐ **Deployment using Local Identity (Public Preview):** Also known as AD-Less Deployment, this feature allows customers to deploy Azure Local with Local identity to simplify edge infrastructure deployment by reducing dependencies.
Learn more: [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-local/deploy/deployment-local-identity-with-key-vault?view=azloc-2510](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-local/deploy/deployment-local-identity-with-key-vault?view=azloc-2510)
- ⭐ **Trusted Virtual Machine Guest Attestation (Public Preview):** This Preview feature lets customers verify that the virtual machine starts in a well-known state by checking the integrity of the entire boot chain. This helps detect any unexpected changes to the boot chain (firmware, OS boot loader, and drivers).
Learn more: [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-local/manage/trusted-launch-vm-overview?view=azloc-2510](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-local/manage/trusted-launch-vm-overview?view=azloc-2510)
- ⭐ **Azure Local Well-Architected Review Assessment:** We are excited to announce the launch of the Azure Local | Well-Architected Review Assessment. If you’re using Azure Local to deploy and operate business-critical workloads, you can use the assessment to answer a list of comprehensive Yes / No questions that align to the five pillars of the Well-Architected framework.
Learn more: [https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/AzureArchitectureBlog/optimize-azure-local-using-insights-from-a-well-architected-review-assessment/4458433](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/AzureArchitectureBlog/optimize-azure-local-using-insights-from-a-well-architected-review-assessment/4458433)

### About the Author / [Thomas Maurer](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/author/d9pe/)

![](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%2080%2080'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

Thomas is the EMEA Global Black Belt (GBB) for Sovereign Cloud at Microsoft, helping organizations across the region harness Microsoft’s sovereign, hybrid, multicloud, and edge solutions. He works directly with C-level leaders and technical teams to remove roadblocks, accelerate digital transformation, and shape long-term cloud strategies that meet business and regulatory needs. With over 15 years of experience in cloud and datacenter, including his previous role as Principal Program Manager and Chief Evangelist for Azure Hybrid, he combines deep technical expertise with a passion for customer success. He specializes in creating scalable architectures, solution accelerators, and thought leadership that drive adoption and innovation on Azure. Thomas is a passionate community advocate and frequently speaks at industry events such as Microsoft Ignite and Microsoft TechDays. He shares his expertise through his Cloud and Datacenter Blog at www.thomasmaurer.ch and on LinkedIn and X.com www.twitter.com/thomasmaurer.
